```{python}
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
```

## 1. Seabonr with pandas data frame

```{python}
# Create a DataFrame from csv file
df = pd.read_csv("data/young-people-survey-responses.csv")

# Create a count plot with "Spiders" on the x-axis
sns.countplot(x = "Spiders", data = df)

# Display the plot
plt.show()
```

## 3. Relationship plot `relplot` and customization

### Subplots
```{python, eval = F}
# Adjust further to add subplots based on family support
sns.relplot(x="G1", y="G3", 
            data=student_data,
            kind="scatter", 
            col="schoolsup",
            col_order=["yes", "no"],
            row = "famsup",
            row_order = ["yes","no"])

# Show plot
```

### Points customization
```{python}
mpg = pd.read_csv("data/mpg.csv")
# Create scatter plot of horsepower vs. mpg
sns.relplot(x="horsepower", y="mpg", 
            data=mpg, kind="scatter", 
            size="cylinders",
            hue = 
            "cylinders")
# Show plot
plt.show()

# Create a scatter plot of acceleration vs. mpg
sns.relplot(x = "acceleration", y = "mpg", data = mpg, kind = "scatter", hue = "origin", style = "origin")
# Show plot
plt.show()
```

### Line plot
```{python}
# Add markers and make each line have the same style
sns.relplot(x="model_year", y="horsepower", 
            data=mpg, kind="line", 
            markers = True,
            ci=None, style="origin", 
            hue="origin",
            dashes = False)

# Show plot
plt.show()
```


## 4. Categorical plot `catplot`

```{python}
survey_data = pd.read_csv("data/young-people-survey-responses.csv")

# Separate into column subplots based on age category
sns.catplot(x="Internet usage", data=survey_data,
            kind="count")
# Show plot
plt.show()

```
